Installation

2024-11-17

install.Rmd

Installing Starsim

Installing Starsim should be straightforward, whether or not you have Python or reticulate already configured on your computer.

First, install devtools if you haven’t already:

install.packages("devtools")
#> Installing package into '/home/runner/work/_temp/Library'
#> (as 'lib' is unspecified)
#> also installing the dependencies 'credentials', 'zip', 'gitcreds', 'ini', 'httpuv', 'xtable', 'sourcetools', 'later', 'promises', 'clipr', 'gert', 'gh', 'rstudioapi', 'shiny', 'htmlwidgets', 'prettyunits', 'xopen', 'brew', 'commonmark', 'stringi', 'stringr', 'cpp11', 'usethis', 'ellipsis', 'miniUI', 'profvis', 'rcmdcheck', 'remotes', 'roxygen2', 'rversions', 'urlchecker'

Second, install the R-Starsim package. This installs the wrapper for Starsim, but not Starsim itself yet.

devtools::install_github("starsimhub/rstarsim")
#> Using github PAT from envvar GITHUB_PAT. Use `gitcreds::gitcreds_set()` and unset GITHUB_PAT in .Renviron (or elsewhere) if you want to use the more secure git credential store instead.
#> Downloading GitHub repo starsimhub/rstarsim@HEAD
#> 
#> ── R CMD build ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> * checking for file ‘/tmp/RtmpLZwD9s/remotes175c7cd97260/starsimhub-rstarsim-5479571/DESCRIPTION’ ... OK
#> * preparing ‘starsim’:
#> * checking DESCRIPTION meta-information ... OK
#> * checking for LF line-endings in source and make files and shell scripts
#> * checking for empty or unneeded directories
#> * building ‘starsim_1.0.0.tar.gz’
#> Installing package into '/home/runner/work/_temp/Library'
#> (as 'lib' is unspecified)

Third, load the wrapper:

library(starsim)

Finally, we install Starsim itself. This step will also install Python (specifically Miniconda) if it’s already available, and will create a virtual environment (r-reticulate) if that’s not available either.

init_starsim()
#> [1] "Python available, skipping Miniconda installation ..."
#> Using Python: /usr/bin/python3.10
#> Creating virtual environment 'r-reticulate' ...
#> + /usr/bin/python3.10 -m venv /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-reticulate
#> Done!
#> Installing packages: pip, wheel, setuptools
#> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-reticulate/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade pip wheel setuptools
#> Virtual environment 'r-reticulate' successfully created.
#> Using virtual environment 'r-reticulate' ...
#> + /home/runner/.virtualenvs/r-reticulate/bin/python -m pip install --upgrade --no-user starsim
